articles.title: Badge of honour to Secy. Kim Jong Il from Russia
articles.content:
Badge of honour to comrade Kim Jong Il from Russia
   Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The great leader comrade
Kim Jong Il was presented with a badge of honour by the 
Russian academy of natural sciences on his 55th birthday.
   A meeting for conveying the badge and its certificate 
was held in Moscow on January 15.
   The academy's president, oleg kuznetsov, asked the DPRK 
ambassador to Russia to convey a congratulatory letter, a 
badge of honour of the academy and its certificate to 
comrade Kim Jong Il.
   The oval badge has a laurel, symbolic of victory and 
glory, inscribed on the left margin and an oak branch, 
symbolic of strength and resolution, on the right margin.
   On the upper part of the badge is a ribbon wrapping the 
laurel and oak branch, which bears letters "in praise of 
merits".
   The badge is made of gold and silver. 
   Seen on the first page of the certificate are golden 
letters "academy of natural sciences of the Russian 
federation. Feb. 16, 1997."
   the certificate also carries letters reading:
   "the standing committee of the academy of natural 
sciences  awards a badge of honour of the academy to comrade 
Kim Jong Il, leader of the democratic people's republic of 
Korea, 'in praise of feats he has performed for science and 
economic development,' according to the jan. 6, 1997 
decision no. 94.
                Registration no. 005."
   the academy's president said the presentation of the 
badge of honour and certificate, the highest commendation of 
his academy, represents the Russian scientists' boundless 
respect for him and their confidence in the cause he is 
leading.

articles.title: Strike continues in S. Korea
articles.content:
Strike continues in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- More than 15,000 
unionists of the "Korean confederation of trade unions" in 
ulsan, most of them being under the influence of the 
federation of trade unions for hyundai group subsidiaries, 
held a rally to win a victory in the third-stage general 
strike for repeal of the recently-revised "labor laws" and 
the "law on the agency for national security planning" on 
January 15, a radio report from seoul said.
   The "Korean confederatioin of trade unions" said that 
some 350,000 workers of more than 380 trade unions will go 
on a strike on jan. 16 in denunciation of the retrogressive 
revision of the laws by the traitorous Kim Young Sam clique. 
   That day upwards of 15,000 unionists of the ulsan 
headquarters of the "Korean confederation of trade unions", 
including those of the federation of trade unions for 
hyundai group subsidiaries held a rally for the 
nullification  of the revised "labor laws."
   more than 2,000 unionists of the "federation of press 
unions"  held a rally in seoul and marched 
through streets together with the unionists of the hankuk 
ilbo and 19 other newspaper offices throughout south Korea 
and the unionists of the yonhap news agency launched a 
strike for a limited time.
   On the 15th of January, about 550 lawyers throughout 
south Korea in a statement branded the secretive passage of 
the "labor laws" and the "law on the ansp" as an outrage 
never witnessed in the history of "constitutional 
government" and called for the complete nullification of 
them.
   On January 16, some 120 professors of seoul national 
university called a press conference and released a 
statement on the situation for repeal of the "ansp law" and 
"labor laws" recently revised against democracy.
   In another development, the south Korean opposition 
"national congress for new politics" and the "united liberal 
democrats" held a joint struggle committee meeting on 
January 15 and declared that they would wage a more powerful 
struggle if the "government power" is used for the 
repression of the strikers.

articles.title: Head of ILO warns S. Korean authority
articles.content:
Head of ILO warns S. Korean authority
   Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The head of the 
international labor organisation appealed to the south 
Korean "government" Wednesday to respect unions' right of 
association, according to  a foreign news report. 
   He told reporters that he sent a letter to the 
traitor Kim Young Sam urging him to respect the labor 
standards south Korea accepted on joining the ilo in 1991.
   The head of the ilo said that if the situation 
is not resolved before the next scheduled meeting of the ilo 
committee on the freedom of association in march, the issue 
would be dealt with by the organization's governing body 
then.

articles.title: Press Review
articles.content:
Press Review
   Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Rodong sinmun today 
highlights a report that the great leader comrade 
Kim Jong Il sent thanks to officials and working people for 
doing good for society and the Collective.
   It is reported in the paper that comrade Kim Jong Il was 
presented with a badge of honour from the Russian academy of 
natural sciences on the occasion of his 55th birthday.
   It carries an article on the great leader president 
Kim Il Sung's idea of attaching importance to Young people 
and the achievements made under his leadership on the 51st 
anniversary of the democratic youth league founded by him.
   Papers frontpage a report that over 350,000 workers of 
380 odd trade unions joined the strike against the 
traitorous Kim Young Sam clique's revision of the "laws" on 
thursday in south Korea.
   Papers inform the readers that mass media of many 
countries give wide publicity to the south Korean workers' 
struggle.
   Rodong sinmun introduces efforts for innovation in 
education this year marking the 20th anniversary of the 
publication of the theses on socialist education.
   The paper gives accounts of the farming preparations 
for this year.
   Papers, in commentaries, denounce the repressive campaign 
of the Kim Young Sam group to destroy the strike of the 
south Korean workers.
   Rodong sinmun carries an article stressing that the 
revised "labour laws" are fascist laws to kill the south 
Korean workers.
   Minju joson prints an article titled "the three charters 
of the country's reunification are important guidelines all 
the nation should defend and maintain".
   Rodong sinmun runs an article titled "the U.S.-Japan 
military alliance bringing dangerous cloud".

articles.title: Fascist murderer hell-bent on suppression of strikers
articles.content:
Fascist murderer hell-bent on suppression of strikers
    Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The Kim Young Sam 
fascist clique held a "meeting of ministers of home affairs, 
justice, trade and industry and three other labor-related 
ministers" on January 15 and decided to 
adopt a strong countermeasure" involving all means, 
describing the general strike of the workers as "illegal".
   Papers here today comment on this.
   A news analyst of Rodong sinmun says:
   by brutally suppressing the peaceful strikers and even 
labor union leaders from abroad the Kim Young Sam group 
reveal their true Colors as a herd of wolves thirsty for 
blood.
   A few days ago the traitor Kim Young Sam said that he 
would take a "special step" as soon as possible for the 
removal of the working people's worries and uneasiness and 
for the improvement of their living conditions.
   But behind the scene the fascist clique hatched a plot 
and gave instructions to suppress the strikers. 
   His act shows that his utterances are a trick to appease 
the angry people and that he has no intention to meet the 
workers' demands.
   His suppression of the members of international labor 
union organisations betrays his true Colors as an 
international fascist gangster.
   Sabre-rattling suppression is not almighty. It will only 
give rise to stronger protests.
   Minju joson  says that the fascist clique's brutal 
suppression will only invite stronger protests of the 
workers and people of other social standings and precipitate 
their self-destruction.

articles.title: Services held to commemorate day of Buddha's attainment of great wisdom
articles.content:
Services held to commemorate day of buddha's attainment of great wisdom
    Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Services were held at 
the temples throughout the northern half of Korea on January 
16 to commemorate the day of buddha's attainment of great 
wisdom.
   Present there were clergymen of the central committee, 
provincial, city and county committees of the Korean 
buddhist federation, resident priests of temples, priests 
and laymen.
   The speakers expressed their firm pledge to  conduct 
various brisk activities for the greater prosperity of the 
country and the motherland and thus discharge the mission 
and duty befitting a buddhist.
   They referred to the danger of the reckless act of the 
south Korean authorities who are hell-bent on the dependence 
on outsiders, flunkeyist treacheries and new war 
preparations, obsessed by the illusion of "unification 
through northward invasion", and expressed their willingness 
to conduct powerful activities to smash the reckless moves 
of the separatist warmaniacs, achieve national independence, 
safeguard peace and create favorable climate for the 
independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
   They called upon all the buddhists in the north, south 
and abroad to make tangible contributions in hearty response 
to the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole 
nation under the banner of national independence and 
peaceful reunification, with the firm faith that the day of 
national reunification is sure to come as they are led by 
the great leader of the nation general Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Very reasonable and realistic reunification formula
articles.content:
Very reasonable and realistic reunification formula
   Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- The workers' party of 
Korea and the DPRK government declared once again that there 
is no change in the position this year, too, to reunify the 
country by means of confederacy with the three principles as 
the guideline.
   It is because the confederacy formula is the way of 
achieving national reunification with confidence at the 
earliest date under the situation in which two different 
ideologies and systems exist in the north and the south of 
Korea.
   The great leader president Kim Il Sung, in his historic 
report at the sixth congress of the WPK in October 1980, 
advanced the proposal for founding the democratic confederal 
republic of koryo as a reunification formula based on 
confederacy.
   This reunification formula is to reunify the country by 
means of founding a pan-national unified state representing 
all parties, all groups and all the members of the nation 
from all walks of life, while leaving the two systems and 
two governments existing in the north and south as they are, 
a confederal state in which the two regional governments of 
the north and the south are represented on an equal footing.
   Comprehensively expounded in the proposal are all the 
problems arising in founding and running the unified state 
such as the principles and way for the formation of the 
confederal state, its character and function, duties of a 
unified government and regional governments and their 
correlation and policy of the confederal state.
   Now that two different systems and two governments 
have existed in the north and the south and either of them 
refuses to concede its own, it conforms to the present 
reality to achieve reunification by means of confederacy.
   The way for the people in the north and the south to 
reunify the country at the earliest date by reconciling and 
uniting themselves as the same nation is only the 
confederacy formula based on one nation, one state, two 
systems and two governments.

articles.title: Execution of fascist laws cannot be tolerated
articles.content:
Execution of fascist laws cannot be tolerated
   Pyongyang, January 17 (KCNA) -- Ri Hong Gu, "Chairman of 
the new Korea party" in South Korea, called a press 
conference on jan. 16, at which he let loose a string of 
shameless remarks that the revision of the "labour laws" was 
an inevitable choice for economic restoration and a new 
leap" and the government has no intention to remake the 
"labour laws" at the present juncture, a seoul-based radio 
report said.
   On January 15, the puppet minister of labour, jin yom, 
said over television and radio that "it is not proper to 
remake the revised labour laws before their execution".
   Thus the Kim Young Sam group undisguisedly revealed their 
intention to legalize and execute  the anti-social, fascist 
labour laws at any cost.
   If the revised "labour laws" are executed, the south 
Korean workers' elementary democratic freedom and rights 
will be totally violated and they will be forced into 
hardships and a subhuman life.  So, the workers and other 
people in south Korea are valiantly struggling to push 
through their demands in defiance of the sword-brandishing 
by the fascist clique.
   The south Korean economy is saddled with foreign debts of 
more than 100 billion dollars and its foreign trade deficit 
ran into a record high of above 23 billion dollars last 
year.  This is because the traitor Kim Young Sam has pursued 
a flunkeyist and anti-social economic policy after he took 
office.
   After his assumption of office he opened the rice 
market, though any preceding dictator dared not do it. He 
led the whole of the south Korean economy to catastrophe.
   The Kim Young Sam group are describing the revised 
"labour laws" as ones for "economic restoration" and a "new 
leap". This only brings their anti-social Colors.
   History shows that those resorting to the fascist laws 
can never remain long.
   The Kim Young Sam group will be overthrown by the massive 
struggle of the people.

articles.title: Korean-Russians support S. Korean strikers
articles.content:
Korean-Russians support S. Korean strikers
   Moscow, January 17 (KCNA) -- Chairman of the Russian 
united confederation of Koreans Ri tong Chol and chairman of 
the Moscow united confederation of Koreans ro Yong jin 
released a joint statement on January 14 supporting the 
escalating massive protests in south Korea against the 
amended "laws on labor affairs and the agency for national 
security planning".
   The statement said the amendments fully betrayed the 
political baseness and inhumanity of the traitor Kim Young 
sam, who ignors any formalities, with no sense of morality 
and honor, trying to prop up his regime and seeking his own 
interests.
   He must promptly repeal the evil laws and accede to the 
strikers' just demand, instead of trying to assuage their 
deep-rooted discontent and wrath, it urged.
   It expressed the belief that the south Korean people will 
continue their struggle in close unity, undaunted by any 
suppression and appeasement, so as to have their just demand 
met without fail.
